meanings.sent1: The teacher misgrades the math tests sometimes.
meanings.sent2: She misgrades the students' essays unintentionally.
meanings.sent3: The robot misgrades the spelling quiz and gives all the students A+.
meanings.sent4: His biased opinion misgrades the importance of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The misgrading of the exam caused confusion among the students.

meanings.definition: A grade or evaluation that is incorrect.
meanings.sent1: The student received a misgrade on his history paper.
meanings.sent2: She was upset when she saw the misgrade on her report card.
meanings.sent3: The misgrade on the test made everyone laugh because it was so off.
meanings.sent4: The misgrade acted like a hidden trap, leading to false expectations.
meanings.sent5: The misgrade stood out like a bright red flag in the sea of correct scores.
